snippet: When Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points against the Knicks on March 2, 1962, he did so in front of no televisions cameras, few reporters and only 4,124 spectators.
abstract: Fifty years ago, on March 2, 1962, Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points for the Philadelphia Warriors in team's 169-147 victory over the New York Knicks; his record stands as one of the great achievements in basketball, but the feat is as much legend as record because he did so in front of no television cameras, few reporters and only 4,124 spectators.
lead_paragraph: When Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points against the Knicks on March 2, 1962, he did so in front of no televisions cameras, few reporters and only 4,124 spectators.

headline.seo: 50th Anniversary of a Scoring Feat That’s as Much Legend as Record
headline.main: 50th Anniversary of a Scoring Feat That’s as Much Legend as Record
headline.print_headline: Feat That’s as Much Legend as Record
